title: Foundation in IT and Networking
description: Start with a strong foundation in general IT. A G.C.E. A/L in a Maths or Technology stream is helpful. Focus on understanding operating systems (especially Linux), computer networks, and basic programming concepts.
institutes: Online platforms like TryHackMe, Hack The Box

title: Formal Education and Foundational Certifications
description: Pursue a degree or higher diploma in IT, Cybersecurity, or Computer Science. Complement your studies with globally recognized entry-level cybersecurity certifications.

title: Security Operations Center (SOC) Analyst
description: Gain hands-on experience in a SOC. In this role, you will monitor security alerts, investigate potential incidents, and use security tools like SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) to protect the organization's assets.

title: Cybersecurity Specialist / Engineer
description: Move into a more specialized role such as a Penetration Tester, Security Engineer, or Incident Responder. This involves proactively finding vulnerabilities, designing secure systems, or managing the response to cyber attacks.
qualifications: Offensive Security Certified Professional (OSCP) for pentesters
CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) for management track

title: Senior Cybersecurity Consultant / Manager
description: Advance to a senior role where you lead security teams, develop security strategies, manage compliance, and advise senior management on risk. This role blends deep technical knowledge with strong leadership and business acumen.
